hackathon-description-text: SwampHacks is a 36 hour open coding event where students become creators. In the time allotted, students from around the country come together at the University of Florida to collaborate on projects, mingle in activities, and network with sponsors for a fully immersive experience.
hackathon-rules:
This hackathon follows MLH's 
Max of 4 people per team.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: This prize is for Infinite Energy's Best Hack! The winning team will receive Arduino Kits and copies of the Lean Startup Book.
The Best Hack for Social Good will be judged on the following criteria:
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: JP Morgan - Best Hack for Social Good

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The prize will be a paid Summer Internship with RealTruck at our Ocala, FL campus.
The prize will be a forever subscription to LaraCasts.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Real Truck - Best Solution to a Common Problem Category

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: This prize is for the team who built an application which provides the best solution to a common problem. The criteria are: Great User Experience, Team that solved the problem and provided the most value to the consumer/customer in their application, Team which demonstrated the highest quality of technical implementation.

The winning project will be selected based on how well it demonstrates the Booz Allen values of Passionate Service and Collective Ingenuity. The winning team members will be awarded with a pair of Beats Headphones!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Booz Allen Hamilton - Passionate Service and Collective Ingenuity

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The organizer's favorite project will be awarded with American Express gift cards and a "small" token to remember SwampHacks IV.
Will be decided through general judging.

Raspberry Pi Kit for Each Team Member
$250 Amazon Web Services Credit for Each Team Member
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: DragonBoard 410c and Power Source for Each Team Member
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best IoT Hack Using a Qualcomm Device

hackathon-description-header: SwampHacks is a 36 hour hackathon where students become creators. Students come to UF to collaborate on projects, mingle in activities, and network with sponsors for a fully immersive experience.
